intro: Leptomeria ellytes, commonly known as the yellow bell heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heaths and heather. The plant is characterized by its small, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and gardeners alike.
